Class ec.ifc.app.ECControlGroup

Class ec.ifc.app.ECControlGroup 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ifc.app.ECControlGroup
public class ECControlGroup
extends Object
implements LayoutManager
ECControlGroup manages a set of views of arbitrary complexity that need to be grouped together and possibly scrolled vertically. The items in the group are themselves ECControlGroupItems. Each ECControlGroupItem can have a text label, and the ECControlGroup helps manage aligning the labels across the set of items.

A typical use is for a scrolling list of items where each item has a text label and a text field, popup menu, or other such control.

See Also:
ECControlGroupItem

DEFAULT_LABEL_WIDTH
myContainer
The container view upon which control items are placed
myItems
The set of ECControlGroupItems to be displayed

width of label area
myScrollGroup
The view that displays the scrolling set of items
myShowLabels
Should the items' text labels be shown?

  public void layoutView(View view,
                         int deltaWidth,
                         int deltaHeight)
Responsibility from layoutManager. If view is one of the set of ECControlGroupItems displayed by this ECControlGroup, this calls layoutContents() on it. If not, it is ignored.

  public void setScrollGroup(ScrollGroup newScrollGroup)
Sets the view that displays the scrolling set of items. This is generally called only at initialization time, but could be switched later.
setShowLabels 
  public void setShowLabels(boolean newValue)
Sets whether or not text labels are currently showing
showLabels 
  public boolean showLabels()
Returns whether or not text labels are currently showing
createContainer 
  protected ContainerView createContainer()
Returns a new ContainerView to use as backdrop for controls. You should never call this, but you might override it to alter the appearance of the container. This default implementation returns a borderless but otherwise generic ContainerView.
